result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Comply with all conditions of the agreement.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sergio L Deberry

records.addlTxt: Deferred Prosecution Agreement - Signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on 4/15/2022
Review hearing on April 13, 2023 at 08:30 am.

08:33 AM Defendant Sergio L Deberry in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl, by zoom.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sergio L Deberry appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case called for plea hearing.
Defendant waives right to appear in person for this hearing.
Defendant plans to enter into a Deferred Prosecution Agreement.
Defense confers in a breakout room.
08:59 AM Defendant Sergio L Deberry in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl, by zoom.  Kevin Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sergio L Deberry appeared by video means with Attorney.
Defense requests approval of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.
State places offer on the record.
Court conducts plea colloquy. 
Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1. 
Court accepts plea as, knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily made. Court withholds the entry of the judgment of conviction as the defendant has been accepted into the DTC in Milwaukee. Court approves the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.
Case is set for review in one year.
  Review hearing scheduled for April 13, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Plea hearing on April 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

09:05 AM Defendant Sergio L Deberry in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl, by zoom.  Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sergio L Deberry appeared by video means with Attorney.
State has complied with victim's right. No victims will be appearing and they have waived appearances. 
Defendant has relocated to a residential facility. The address has been updated. 
Defense has reached an agreement with the state with a Deferred Prosecution Agreement and participation in Drug Treatment Court. 
State is prepared to go to plea today, but Atty Ertl is being called back to trial.
Parties may appear by zoom.  Atty Ertl will facilitate zoom appearance for his client from UCC.


  Plea hearing scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Check Case scheduled for April 6, 2022.

08:38 AM Defendant Sergio L Deberry in court by zoom video, in custody from the Milwaukee County Jail, with attorney Christopher John Ertl by zoom video.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Defendant to appear by video from the Milwaukee County Jail for the next date.  Hearing scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.
